attributes.action: lessen the costs of public transport in london
attributes.additional_details: this will not only benefit the general public but will also enable tfl to crack down on people who evade buying tickets, this will save the government money and also creates a more substantial revenue for the company, as of right now due to constant strikes the public are getting tired and angry, if action isn’t taken soon this will cause more harm than good.
attributes.background: lower tfl prices making public transport easier and more accessible for the general public

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
